newsitem.title: USA: US corporate bonds close down, tobacco cuts losses.
newsitem.headline: US corporate bonds close down, tobacco cuts losses.

text.p: U.S. corporate high-grade bonds dropped more than one point in thin trade with U.S. Treasuries into the close, although tobacco debt shed some losses sustained this week, dealers said.
Philip Morris Cos Inc's debt due 2006 was quoted at 95 bid, 90 offer at the close compared with a 98 bid near mid-session. The notes widened approximately 10 basis points on the week.
Volatility for tobacco debt ensued legal wranglings and governmental approval of Federal Drug & Alcohol Administration rules aimed at curbing tobacco sales to minors, dealers said.
